results.title: Roads in the sky
results.creator_credit: International Civil Aviation Organization. Public Information Office
results.brief_description: Role of aviation in less technologically developed regions of the world. Tells the story of how the aeroplane helps economic development where roads and railways cannot economically be built. Includes a modern Canadian airport; a Mardi Gras, and mountainous terrain with old and new modes of land travel in Haiti; air commerce in the Brazilian hinterland and Brazilia.

results.title: Roadcraft
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Elisabeth Knight and Greg Reading
results.brief_description: Australian mime and comic Jean-Paul Bell features in this light-hearted filmic look at a serious subject: how to drive in order to prevent collisions. This film is aimed at the more experienced driver as well as the novice. Narrated by Graeme Blundell.

results.title: Road transport trends
results.creator_credit: Country Roads Board and Jim Stirling
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the growing importance and use of Victoria’s roads by transports and by private motorists. Shows the assistance given to designers of motor vehicles in estimating probable load capacity by the Country Roads Board. Explains the careful control of over-dimensional loads for which 15,000 permits are needed annually and show the detailed planning needed for safe and convenient handling of such loads as mobile cranes, houses and earth-moving equipment for which escorts, special equipment and timing is needed.

results.title: Road to the West
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Alex Ezard
results.brief_description: The story of the early days of Sydney Cove told by means of historical stills and by the re-enactment of the crossing of the Blue Mountains by Blaxland, Wentworth and Lawson, the resulting development and relics of that period, including the old Court House at Hartley. Today fast transport enables commuters to travel to and from Sydney and the Blue Mountains in less than two hours, passing through towns named after the three explorers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Artransa Park Studios, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Alex Ezard

results.title: Road to the stamping ground (A)
results.creator_credit: Nederlandse Omroep Stichting, RM Arts and David Muir
results.brief_description: A choreographical journey with Jiri Kylian of the Netherland’s Dance Theatre into the world of dance in Indigenous Australia. The documentary which opens the program follows Kylian’s visit to the Groot Eylandt tribal dance congregation in 1986 where his dance production Stamping Ground was first conceived. In Stamping Ground Kylian sought to underline the common qualities of ballet and Aboriginal tribal dance as well as fuse the two styles into a work that comments on the universal nature of human movement as a form of cultural and personal expression. Following interviews with the Dance company performers about the piece and footage of rehearsals demonstrating movements inspired by Kylian’s time at the Groot Eylandt congregation, the second half of the program is a presentation of the final performance of Stamping Ground by the Netherlands Dance Theatre Company.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nederlandse Omroep Stichting, RM Arts and David Muir

results.title: Road to security
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Roy A. Driver
results.brief_description: Outlines briefly the history and general principles of insurance and shows the work of insurance companies in accepting risks and providing security against fire, accidents, personal injury, marine and general property loss.

results.title: Road to Nhill
results.creator_credit: Gecko Films, Australian Film Commission, Sue Maslin and Sue Brooks
results.brief_description: This affectionate observation of life in a small country town follows the events of a lazy summer’s afternoon in Pyramid Hill, Victoria. A car load of local lady bowlers flips over on the way home from a tournament. Confusion escalates as word about the accident spreads around the town. Husbands go astray searching for their wives; helpful passers-by take the women involved in the accident in all directions; the ambulance gets lost; and the local policeman misses the accident all together. The film is the first feature for the director/ producer/writer team after several years of documentaries and short films, many of them award-winning.

results.title: Road to Canterbury
results.brief_description: Malcolm Muggeridge, follows the Pilgrim’s Way from Southwark to Canterbury Cathedral, a route made famous in Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales. It traverses the whole range of 20th century England from the slums, through new housing estates to historic towns. The group discusses the question “Is a belief in God important today?” and visit some institutions on their way to try and help find the answer.

results.title: Road to Canterbury
results.creator_credit: British Lion Films, London Film Productions and David Eady
results.brief_description: This great Roman thoroughfare was the path of the medieval pilgrims described in Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales. Evoking memories of Shakespeare and Dickens, the camera follows the road from St Paul’s Cathedral in London, through towns and villages and the Kentish orchards and hopfields to Canterbury Cathedral which St Augustine made the centre of Christianity in England nearly 1400 years ago.
